summary: 07/02/1993: Thirty-five people were killed and about 60 injured when Turkish fundamentalists, engaged in a protest against the visit of Salman Rushdie's editor, set fire to the hotel in which he was staying.
target1: Turkish author Aziz Nesin, who had translated Salman Rushdie's novel The Satanic Verses.
motive: To protest against Salman Rushdie's novel The Satanic Verses.
scite1: “35 dead, 60 injured in hotel fire set by Turkish fundamentalists,” Agence France Presse, July 3, 1993.
scite2: “Rushdie appalled as 40 die in book protests,” Agence France Presse, July 2, 1993.
scite3: Hugh Pope, “Muslim Mob Torches Hotel,” Los Angeles Times, July 3, 1993.
